commitResults.messageTitle: Implement Greet, Echo and Exit for Babe
commitResults.messageBody:
Duke has been renamed as Babe.

Several skeletal functionalties were added:
- Greets user.
- Listens to input from user and repeats after them.
- Terminate the chat session once "bye"is received from user.

commitResults.messageTitle: Fragment listenAndRepeat() into listen() and print()
commitResults.messageBody:
To optimize code reuse, listenAndRepeat() has been broken
down into two separate functions:
a) listen()
- Receives user input
b) print()
- Prints user-input word stored in Babe's memory

Also, this change relocates control to exit Babe to the loop in
main() of Babe.java.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add functionality to store and list multiple items
commitResults.messageBody:
Babe no longer repeats words entered by user back to them.

It now stores the input into a string array, and list them out in a
numbered list when asked to.

Babe allows its users to store a list.

To make a functional to-do list, users should be able to mark the
list items as Done/Undone.

Also, this commit adds checkboxes next the each item on the list.

commitResults.messageTitle: Allow Babe to detect instructions more efficiently
commitResults.messageBody:
Prior to this, in order to detect a status change for an item,
Babe will extract the first word of userInput string in a separate
process and check for for "mark" and "unmark".

However, this requires code that caters to each instruction such as
"mark" and "unmark" to ensure that extraction of substring does not
encounter NullPointerException.

By making userInput an ArrayList of String type, and parsing the
string into the ArrayList, to obtain an instruction from a user
input (apart from add item functionality), we simply have to get
the first element from the ArrayList.

Thus, in this commit, we:
- Change userInput from type String to ArrayList
- Remove checkChangeStatus() that detects whether current
instruction asks for mark/unmark
- Add helper function to rebuild user input from the ArrayList

commitResults.messageTitle: Create Item class for all list items in Babe
commitResults.messageBody:
In Level-4 (yet to be implemented), the list items in Babe now has a
few different types, namely, ToDos, Deadlines and Events.

Each of these Items keeps track of different data, and has different
String representations.

Thus, in this commit, Item is abstracted from Babe's list as a
standalone abstract class, with each different type of Item as its
subclasses for ease of usage and better encapsulation.

Each Item now stores a String content and additional String data
such as deadlines and start/end date depending on the object. The
Done status is also now recorded in each Item.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add functionality to add ToDos, Deadlines and Events
commitResults.messageBody:
Items added to Babe's list can be in either of these forms:
ToDos, Deadlines and Events. Each of them has a different String
representation.

This commit depreciates previous general addItem() function and
introduces functions to add each type of items to the list.

commitResults.messageTitle: Babe.java: Fix bugs that cause NoSuchElementException during script test
text-ui-test: Add input.txt and EXPECTED.TXT for semi-automate testing of Babe

commitResults.messageBody:
Babe will be more restrictive in the coming updates.

It will not accept a Task with no description, and it only
recognizes a pool of commands.

commitResults.messageTitle: Babe.java: Add exception handling for NoDescriptionException and NonsenseInputException
